turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new running shoes. Can you recommend some?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me a bit about your running habits? For example, how many miles do you run per week, what kind of surfaces do you typically run on (road, trail, track), and do you have any preferences in terms of cushioning or support?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I usually run about 20-25 miles a week, mostly on roads and sidewalks. I prefer shoes with good cushioning because my knees tend to bother me. I'm a neutral runner, I think?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thanks! Based on your preferences, I'd recommend checking out the Hoka Clifton, the Brooks Glycerin, and the New Balance Fresh Foam 1080. They're all known for their excellent cushioning and are popular choices for road running. You can find links to these products on our website. Do any of these pique your interest?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: The Hoka Clifton looks interesting. But all the reviews I read say they wear down quickly. Is that true, and if so, are there any similar shoes with better durability?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a great question! The Clifton's midsole can indeed wear down faster than some other models, which is a common trade-off for the cushioning. If durability is a major concern, you might consider the Saucony Kinvara, although it has slightly less cushioning. Alternatively, the Brooks Ghost is generally well-regarded for a balance of cushioning and durability. I will add links to those as well.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, okay. The Saucony Kinvara sounds like a good option. But, the thing is, I have pretty wide feet. Do they come in wider sizes? I'm getting really frustrated; I can't ever find shoes that fit right!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Let me check availability for the Saucony Kinvara in wide sizes... It appears that the Kinvara does come in a wide width option. I'll update the link for you to the wide option. I am also going to include links to other models that often have wide sizes, such as the Brooks Glycerin and the New Balance 1080. Would you like me to look for any other brands or features?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: That's great, thanks! The Kinvara wide sounds like the winner. I appreciate your help!
